text: On tap at Kulovy Blesk. Amber with a lasting white head. Herbal and spicy aroma with straw and grass. Dry herbal and grassy flavour with a nice bitter finish.

Sampled at U Kunstatu, Prague. Pours hazy deep golden with a moderate big creamy white head. Aroma is fruity, with lots of lemon. Taste is herbal hops, some good citrussy notes, sweet marmelad malts in the back, never overpowering this hoppy driven big lager.

Bottle. Enormous thanks to Ivan R. & Mirna for sharing! Really glad to finally tried this one. Memorable name, funny from a Croatian perspective in more ways than one (so are plenty of things here for Czechs, so dont worry, its reciprocal). Ahaaanyway, poured a misty golden body with a good thick white head. Pungent aroma, lemony and herbal notes, ending dry. Huge herbal and nicely fresh lemony taste, vague grapefruit and/or lime notes perhaps, its a mixed bag in that manner. All in all, nicely citric. Ends with solid, quality bitterness. I have to admit I kinda dig Agnus if its still used! Another great hoppy beer from Matuka
Tapping on the House pub, nice orange color, firm foam, a distinctive citrus flavor, rather hopped, prominent alcohol strength, strong beer.

Výčap Kulový blesk. Tmavia zlatá farba, biela hustá pena. Dlho drala. Vôňa chmeľová, horká, jemne citrusová. Chuť opäť plná chmeľu, citrusové a grapefruitové tóny, troku pikantnosť na konci. Dlhá horká dochuť.

(bottle, gusher) hazy deep golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of cooked beans and nettles, with a touch of pale malts, bread dough and cactus juice. flavour is mostly caramelized pale malts and peanuts, rather sweet, with some more kidney beans, a hint of tahin and nettles in the finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Lahev (7,5 dl, Díky Michale!): Golden, nearly clear, big ;loose and slowly collapsing white head; moderate to solid spicy (not only Saazy) herbal hoppy nose, some yeast (?) in the background; almost solid dryish bitter flavour, some (malty) sweetness well detectable, medium bodied and pretty soft; lingering and solid bitter (with hops sticking to the palate) finish with a good pale-malty counterpart. Great and well balanced stuff. S radostí...

Aroma is floral, fruity, wooden and mild grassy notes. Flavour is floral, grassy, herbal and bready with some mild wooden and grainy notes.

On tap Worthy of the Manuka brand, strong, elegant. Nice color, good feel on the tongue, lingers after drinking. This beer makes me want to be a sailor. Well, maybe not... :-) Well above average, good one.
Tap at HBF 2016, Helsinki. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, grain, sweetness, some hops and malts.
Bottle 750ml at HBF2016. Golden color, small white head. Aroma is grassy, fruity. Medium-bodied. Grassy, light citrus, some fruits. Nice fruity lager.

750ml [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2016. Pours clear orange with a smooth head. Aroma of grass, hay, pine, citrus and herbal notes. Taste is smooth, grassy and herbal with hints of hay, citrus and pine. Finish is grassy and crisp with some herbal notes. Okay.
750ml bottle. Golden color, thin white head. Sweet floral, hay in aroma. Hay, grassy notes, hops, grains in flavor. Drinkable. Nice.

Tap at dobre časy. Clear golden colour with white head off. Aroma of malts, citrus fruits. Taste of grass, malty,caramel sweetness, light notes of citrus fruits, huge bitter aftertaste. Moderate carbonation.

Blonde tres legerement orangee, carbo moyenne, collet moyen persistant.
Aromes cereales et herbes seches, pointe citronnee
Vive des lattaque, fluide et bien seche en final, toujours sur les cereales avec des notes de pain, amertume et saveurs citronnees reste bien longtemps.
Decidement cette brasserie tcheques fait des merveilles. Jadore !
Bottle.Nice wild hops notes coming trough the mouth,good balanced,good drinkible.Nice one.

750ml bottle, thank you Ryan! Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma is malty, citrus, cereals, light hay, yeasts. Flavour is medium sweet with a light bitter end, a bit unbalanced. Medium body, medium to light carbonation. So so...
Bottle. Hazy orange color with nice white head. Aroma - Bread, hops, grass. Taste - Bitter, hops, grass, malts, fruit.

Bottle, pours orange cloudy color with a medium white cap. Nose: cereals, malty, yeasty. Mouth: medium carbonation, malts, not that bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2015 @Kulovy Blesk in Prague. Golden-orange body with some white froth and moderate carbonation. Biscuit, cracker, florals, and grass... but not the crispness of the great pils and lagers floating around Prague. Medium bodied with moderate sweetness and a somewhat muddled finish.

Shared bottle. Pours is golden clear with medium long lasting creamy white head. Aroma of malts, caramel, yeast, spicy, butter, lot of floral and grassy notes. Taste is bitter, light sweet, butter and grassy mouthfeel. Medium to heavy body, creamy texture, bitter finish.

I like such pils! The CZ Agnus hops is more than welcomed! Nice colour, smell and full palate. Slightly hazy guild with nice sticky head. Aroma oddly hoppy. Strange since most Czech beer is low hopped (including the IPAs) and heres this Pils that smells hoppy. Go figure. Taste follows atoms in bitterness. Very nice in my opinion, though not necessarily a Pilsner... Nevertheless a very nice beer.

Bottle 0,75. Little hazy golden body, very high white head. Aroma of citruses, especially lemons; wet grass, flowers, grains. Taste is bitter with medium sweetness. Floral hops, grass, lemons and behind this full sweet malty body. Little bit warming. Very smooth mouthfeel, long and pleasant bitter aftertaste, high carbonatin.Perfect rich flavoured lager.

Bottle 0,75l. Little bit cloudy, gold colored beer. Pleasant aroma of floral and a bit citrusy hops, pale malt, grains, fruits. Moderately sweet flavor of malt and hops, pleasantly bitter, moderately full bodied. Very tasty.

0.4 l, čapované v Lokal pube. Krásna vôňa, kvety, citrusy. Parádna hustá, dobre držiaca pena, chuť príjemne horkastá. Nebíčko v papuľke!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Barva zlatavá.V?n? chmelová, tro?ku po citrusech. Chu? plná, výrazn? ho?ká s p?íjemným dozvukem.

(tap 0,5l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma : Sweet, light herbal.
Appearance : Clear golden color. Medium white head.
Taste : Medium sweet, spicy.
Palate : Medium-full body. Light warm finish.
Overall : Nice stronger beer.
Barva: střední zlatá, pěna vysoká. Vůně: lehká chmelová s citrusovým nádechem. Chuť: výborný hořký nástup, plné tělo, příjemné grepové pozadí, dlouhý chmelovýb dozvuk
Bottle shared by Dedollewaitor, thanks buddy. Hazy orange body with a large offwhite head. Citric, hoppy and fuity nose. Lots of hops and fruit. Ends very bitter. Wow nice pilsner.
Draught @ T Anker, Prague. Pours clear golden with a creamy white head and lacings. Bitter fresh grassy hops and mild citrus. Hay and biscuit. Really dry hoppy final. Clean and quaffing. Nice.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 240414

Bottle @ Rasmus. Pours golden with a white head, loads of lively bubbles. Aroma of malt, light grain, sweet fruity hops, orangepeel, grapefruit. Flavor is malt, fruity hops, citrus, grapefruit. Medium body, lively carbonation. 2404014
Bottle, 6.3%. Hazy dark yellow with medium white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, grass, grainy, hay and hop. Flavour is malt, fruit, grass, grainy, medium sweet, caramel, hay and a medium bitter.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are malt, grass, straw, hops and notes of alcohol. Light bitter and grassy finish.

Bottle from U Modrého lva. Aroma honeyish, malty, light hops. Tempting. Clear golden colour. Taste is on the hoppy side with harmonic Czech character. Honeyish background malt sweetness. Nice bitter hoppy finish. Higher carbonation, easily drinkable. Very good.

Bottled. Pours clean golden body with a beautiful and stable snow head. Nose is a bit agressive by some citruss-flavoured and malts notes, although the aroma is rich and very interesting. Tastes pretty bitter, agressively flavoured, lively carbonized, sticky texture, very long and bitter finish. Nice, but a bit strong, although as it should be.
Bottle. Pours hazy amber/dark golden color, white head. Aroma is hoppy, grapefruit. Taste is really hoppy for a lager, grapefruit, tangerines. Nice hoppy finish, with lightly sweet ending.

75 cl bottle. Somewhat hazy golden beer with a decent offwhite head. Hoppy fruity aroma, mango, peach, bready, spicy notes, some hay. Fruity hop flavor, floral, citrus, resin, bready notes. Clean and drinkable but not totally exciting.

Bottle: Thanks Cuso: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Medium to bigger sized off white foamy head on top of a hazy orange colored beer.
Aromas of hop, hop flowers, citrus, nettle, hay, some orange and plant tones and a sprinkle of sharper floral tones.
Flavours of hops, hop bitters, hop flowers, citrus, grapefruit, herbs, bitters, nettle, floral tones, some hops, floral tones, some plant tones, some light yeasty tones and a hay and grassy touch towards the finish.
Aftertaste of floral hops, bitters, herbs, nettle and some hay/grass tones.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium to lightly fuller bodied and a creamy texture.
Nice! Easy drinkable and balanced with a cripsy creamy touch.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle from Richtar Jakub.  Dark golden color with thick white head. Nice hoppy aroma. Nice hoppy taste with grapefruit, grapefruit zest, peppery notes. Long hoppy bitter finish. Tasty.
Tapped at Hostinec Richtar Jakub in Bratislava/Slovakia. Hoppy aroma, überhoppy taste for a lager, nice copper color, stable creamy head. This tasty beer is excellent! A nice sipper for colder days.

Bottle. Pours nice cloudy golden liquid with big frothy, but quickly disappearing head. Aroma is not like an ordinary lager - lot of fruitiness, also some pine, but typical bready line is present, too. Taste is little bit unexpected, starts sweet, but became very bitter. Beer has a full body, thick texture (navy lager) and average carbonation. Ends with long dry finish. Probably best lager for me, since Im not so educated in this genre.

Bottle. Slightly over Golden with a dense white head. Aroma is tremendous. Like Saaz diluting juice and bread dough. The flavour initially pays out on the promise of the aroma but then gives way to a fairly rampant bitterness. As the bottle progresses, it grows less charming. Nice enough and a break from the norm.

on tap @ zelena  kocka pivarium, Brno. nice amber appearence with white head which stays. aroma is grass, pine and bready.  a bit of a come down after tasting their IPA. Taste is suprisingly different. Now comes through the hops which seem hidden in the aroma. medium body. slighly bitter but nice soft hop aromas coming thorugh. seems like they again have used american hops in this lager/pils which is very different and great.

My Bottom Line:
Earthy, leafy hops are balanced out by silky honeyed malts while orange-y fruitiness adds depth to this polished brew.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam floats atop the misty amber.
-This tastes and feels like a well tendered cask ESB.
-Drinkability is quite high despite the hoppy intensity.
-Mouthfeel is healthy ; not dry, but not too sweet either.

On tap at Nota Bene, Praha.

On tap at Nota Bene Restaurant (01/03/13). Slightly hazy gold pour, white head. Aroma is really fruity, hops are peachy turn earthy turn leafy, lots of vegetal aromas, dank, leafy, fruity english malt/yeast. Taste is bitter, fruity, resinous vegetal finish. Definitely a new world style, really a hybrid of several things, didnt really get any pils character here. Not bad, but I prefer their IPAs by a mile and a half.
Bottle. Pours cloudy orange to golden with nice white head. Aroma is hops, grass, citrus fruits, hint of raisins. Flavor is bitter, hops, grass, malt, raisins, hint of citrus fruits.

Pale yellow color with big white head. Aroma of  malts, diacetyl, honey notes as well. Taste is light bitter then light to medium sweet and the end is dry and bitter. Good balance. Medium body, oily texture, avarage carbonation. Pretty nice beer.

0.75l bottle from Pivni Rozmanitosts stall at Pragues Easter market on Namesti republiky. Hazy deep golden colour, bin white head. Grainy malty base, lots of hop with a lemony, resiny character, reminding me strongly of an IPA. Full-bodied and smooth - a delicious and very hoppy beer.

Bottle. Pours dark amber with a huge, frothy, rocky head - beautiful to look at! The nose is initially disappointing, given the brewer. Intensive grassy-herbal Czech hops, a lot of malt that is somewhere between worty and bready, some apples and basement aromas. Well, like a regular Czech pils, not really above average. But the taste is much better! A full malty body, only a tad sweet but oily and almost sticky in the mouth, a strong noble bitterness and an aftertaste of hops, basement and nuts. Very well balanced and better when it warms up a bit. Almost like a sticky-bodied märzen thats been really assertively hopped. What a nice surprise!

Drafted at Klub Malych pivovaru.A beer full of flavor but I found the bitterness to be a bit too much!I just didnt think it was so well balanced.The after taste is nothing more than a burning bitterness that doesnt have any other flavor..Dont get me wrong,I am a big fan of bitter beers but this just needs a bit more balance..I found myself struggling to drink this after my first beer..

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2013 nuts, caramel, cereal, floral, spruce, herbs, basement aromas, leather, barnyard, rotten eggs, cooked vegetables, clove, vanilla, amber, sparkling, white foam, tan foam, rocky head, light sweetness, very bitter, heavily sour, umami, salty, full body, creamy, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish, bitter,

on tap at klub malych pivovaru. regular amber with a slim and steady head; plenty of biscuity malt showing through and hints of honey and crepe suzette with metallic bitterness. not a bad beer but im not really sure what they were trying to do with this one apart from adding another beer to their impressive portfolio
Bottle from Pivonka. Really good czech brew,pretty strong and with pleasant taste and long palate.
Draft. An amber beer with a lazing off-white head. The aroma has notes of minerals and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, straw, and minerals, leading to a dry and bitter finish.

Keg at the Euston Tap, London. Pours a clearish, gold-yellow with a big, white head. Sweet nose, some grain and cereal. Flavor is sweet with some straight sugar, light caramel, slight grass and herbal bitterness. Light to medium in body with lively carbonation. Sweet finish, slightly tangy, some cereal and light caramel. Ok, but condition could likely be better.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, CopenhagenGolden color, hazy; creamy head. Wonderful aroma, noble hops and biscuity malt, with a sweet accent, and light manure. Some good malt flavor is unfortunately crushed by an oppriment bitterness, that leads to a completely out-of-control final, burning. Undoubtly they used some noble hops, but the result is not fascinating, and mostly disappointing after the promises of the aroma.

Prague Beer Museum, Prága. Áttetsző sárgás-narancssárgás szín, hófehér habbal a tetején. Illata enyhén malátás, citrusos, és van egy fehérszőlőből készült, nem túl finom musthoz hasonló aromája is. Ízébe a maláta mellett érződik egy levés tejkaramell is, a kesernyés komló itt csak a háttérben bujkál, és van egy nehezen megfogalmazható utóíze, ami valahogy nem illik oda. Száraz, nem túl keserű, közepesen testes ital. Nem rossz, de nem tudtam eldönteni, hogy ez most miért is jó, vagy éppen miért nem. Furcsa egy kicsit...
De barril. Deep golden hazy colour, white medium head. Malty hoppy grassy aroma. Hoppy grassy citus and malty lightly spiced flavour.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Cph.
Orange pale amber pour, with a small, staying, creamy, off-white head. Aroma has caramel, light butter, flowers, grass and a light fruity note. Highish carbonation, rather prickly, good dry and light creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is powerfully bitter, lots of grass and hay, light grainy malts. Bordering on being too harsh in bitterness.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Hazy orange coloured with a small white head.
Malty aroma of hay with notes of sulphur.
Malty flavour of caramel, hops, grass, citrus and hops.
Dry hoppy finish.

Draught at MikkellerBAR. Clear amber - white head.
Roasted. Peppery. Light hoppy. Hay. Grainy. Light bitterness. Ryebread notes. Lovely dryness. Nice.
Nose is hazel, bitter hops, later burnt caramel, feel is medium, carb is mediumweak, taste is spiced hops, leaves,

From tap at MikkellerBar as Sailor/Navy Lager. Pours hazy dark orange with a small white head. Aroma is saaz hoppy and slight hayish. Fruity, hayish and distinct hoppy. Slight herbal spiced and fruity. Bitter and hoppy finish. Overload of saaz :)
